channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-7641] Port HBASE-6669 'Add BigDecimalColumnInterpreter for doing aggregations using AggregationClient' to trunk
item.description:
ColumnInterpreter implementation in trunk is different from that in 0.94

This issue ports BigDecimalColumnInterpreter to trunk
item.summary: Port HBASE-6669 'Add BigDecimalColumnInterpreter for doing aggregations using AggregationClient' to trunk

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I started working on porting this to trunk. This is the first time i am working on Protobuf. It seems like i need a equivalent of org.apache.hadoop.hbase.protobuf.generated.HBaseProtos.LongMsg for BigDecimal(BigDecimalMsg)? I know that LongMsg is a autogenerated code. Can someone tell me how to create or generate BigDecimalMsg. Thanks.

Hi again

Great to see you working on this!
As I currently started cleaning out the code of a custom coprocessor and forward port it, I also looked into forward porting BDCI. I don't know, how far you got, so far, but if you're interested, we could make this a joint effort.

Hey Julian,

Sure we can work together on this. At present, I need help in Protobuf stuff, if you have experience then please guide me. Thanks.

Hi,

just "found" protobufs output. Followed the README to compile protobuf
and compiled following the directions on the protobuf page [1].
I added the following code snippet to hbase.proto in
/hbase/hbase-protocol/src/main/protobuf:
message BigDecimalMsg

{ required string bigdecimalMsg = 1; }

Then I compiled from that directory using " protoc --java_out=../java
./hbase.proto". The output will then go to the correct package in the
java source tree, as it is defined at the beginning of hbase.proto.

As mentioned before, this will just define a String, though, as
defining BigDecimal directly is impossible. Therefor I made some
slight changes in BDCI:
@Override
public BigDecimalMsg getProtoForCellType(BigDecimal t)

{ BigDecimalMsg.Builder builder = BigDecimalMsg.newBuilder(); return builder.setBigDecimalMsg(t.toString()).build(); }

@Override
public BigDecimalMsg getProtoForPromotedType(BigDecimal s)

{ BigDecimalMsg.Builder builder = BigDecimalMsg.newBuilder(); return builder.setBigDecimalMsg(s.toString()).build(); }

@Override
public BigDecimal getPromotedValueFromProto(BigDecimalMsg r)

{ return new BigDecimal(r.getBigDecimalMsg()); }

@Override
public BigDecimal getCellValueFromProto(BigDecimalMsg q)

{ return new BigDecimal(q.getBigDecimalMsg()); }

However there seem to be some methods missing in the generated source.
I'll try to get that fixed.
Also my build system seems a little fucked up right now. I'll get that
fixed and test it.

Julian

[1] https://developers.google.com/protocol-buffers/docs/javatutorial
For ease of working on this, here is what I've done, so far. I will get this tested, as soon as possible.

@Julian:
Thanks for your work.
In 0.94, there is TestBigDecimalColumnInterpreter.java

@Julian:
Can you consolidate the attachments into one patch ?

Please also include the diff in HBaseProtos.java in the patch as well.

Thanks

I hope that this is kind of what you wanted.
Are there any guidelines for patches, somewhere?

You can find guideline here:
http://wiki.apache.org/hadoop/Hbase/HowToContribute
Forward ported BigDecimalColumnInterpreter to head.

Overall patch looks good.


+public class BigDecimalColumnInterpreter extends ColumnInterpreter<BigDecimal, BigDecimal, EmptyMsg, BigDecimalMsg, BigDecimalMsg> {

Please wrap long line - limit is 100 characters.


+

+ public BigDecimal getValue(byte[] colFamily, byte[] colQualifier, KeyValue kv)

Missing @Override


+     return (bd1 == null) ? bd2 : bd1; // either of one is null.

+   } else if (bd1 == null) // both are null

+   {

'else' is not needed above. Please put the '{' at the end of 'else if' line.


+ public BigDecimal castToReturnType(BigDecimal o) {

+   return o;

nit: some parameters are named bd, some o. Better be consistent.

For the test:


+   * @return

+   */

+  private static byte[][] makeN(byte[] base, int n) {

There're a lot of long lines in test, such as:


+    final ColumnInterpreter<BigDecimal, BigDecimal, EmptyMsg, BigDecimalMsg, BigDecimalMsg> ci = new BigDecimalColumnInterpreter();

Please wrap.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12570673/HBASE-7641.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces lines longer than 100

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestHTableMultiplexer

Since TestConstraint is a medium test, the large tests were not executed in the above QA run.

Please use dev-support/hbase_eclipse_formatter.xml as formatter.
The indentation should be two spaces.


+		if (bd1 == null ^ bd2 == null) {

+			return (bd1 == null) ? bd2 : bd1; // either of one is null.

+		} else if (bd1 == null) {

nit: there is no need for the 'else' keyword.

Hi Ted,
fixed that; removed the else keyword. Formatted with the eclipse formatter, however it did not split lines longer, than 100. Is it not supposed to do that, also?
However, I fail to see the connection to the failing tests. I'll check tis again, before submitting another patch.

@Julian:
Please wrap the long line manually.

If you use Eclipse to work on HBase, you can easily see the long lines in your code by turning on 'Show print margin' option in Preferences -> General -> Editors -> Text Editors and specifying 100 as Print margin column.
Patch v3 fixes spacing.

Looks good overall. Some nits:
1. The methods getProtoForCellType and getProtoForPromotedType have very similar code. Maybe have these methods call a common method?
2. There are unused imports in BigDecimalColumnInterpreter.java

+1 otherwise.
Patch v4 addresses Devaraj's comments

Thanks for the patch, Julian.

Thanks for the review, Devaraj.
